# Complete Guide

> For execution instructions, see [SKILL.md](../SKILL.md)

# Content Distribution Mastery

## Overview
Get your content seen by the right audience through strategic distribution across owned, earned, and paid channels. This skill helps solo entrepreneurs maximize reach without a big marketing budget.

---

## When to Use This Skill

- Launching new content
- Growing audience
- Increasing organic reach
- Driving website traffic
- Building brand awareness
- Amplifying existing content
- Cross-platform strategy

---

## Distribution Channels

### The 3 Types

**1. Owned Channels (You Control)**
- Email list
- Website/blog
- Social media profiles
- Podcast
- YouTube channel

**2. Earned Channels (Others Share)**
- Social shares/reposts
- Backlinks
- Guest posts/podcasts
- Press mentions
- Community discussions

**3. Paid Channels (You Pay)**
- Social ads (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter)
- Google ads
- Sponsored content
- Influencer partnerships

**Strategy:** Build owned → Leverage earned → Scale with paid

---

## Owned Channel Distribution

### 1. Email List (Highest ROI)

**Why email first:**
- You own the list (platform-independent)
- Highest engagement (20-40% open rates)
- Direct to inbox (no algorithm)
- Drives traffic reliably

**Distribution strategy:**
```
Content published → Email to list within 24 hours

Email structure:
Subject: [Hook related to content]
Body:
- Quick insight/tease (50 words)
- "Read the full post: [link]"
- Benefit of reading ("You'll learn...")

Send time: Tuesday-Thursday, 9-11 AM (best open rates)
```

**Segmentation:**
```
Segment by:
• Topic interest (marketing, sales, growth)
• Engagement level (opens/clicks)
• Subscriber source (lead magnet A vs. B)

Send relevant content to each segment (higher CTR)
```

---

### 2. Website/Blog (SEO Hub)

**On-Page Distribution:**
- **Related posts** (sidebar/end of post)
- **Internal linking** (link to 3-5 related posts)
- **Content upgrades** (lead magnets within posts)
- **Email opt-ins** (popups, inline forms)

**SEO Optimization:**
```
• Keyword-optimized title (H1)
• Meta description (155 chars, includes keyword)
• Internal links (to older posts)
• External links (to authority sites)
• Alt text on images (keyword-rich)
• Schema markup (structured data)
```

**Content Hubs:**
```
Create topic clusters:

Pillar page: "Complete Guide to Cold Email"
  ↳ Cluster 1: "Subject Lines"
  ↳ Cluster 2: "Personalization"
  ↳ Cluster 3: "Follow-Ups"

All clusters link back to pillar (SEO boost)
```

---

### 3. Social Media Platforms

**Platform-Specific Strategy:**

**LinkedIn (B2B, Professionals):**
```
Frequency: 3-5 posts/week
Best times: Tue-Thu, 9-11 AM, 12-2 PM
Content types:
• Text posts (insights, lessons)
• Carousels (frameworks, step-by-step)
• Videos (short-form, talking head)
• Articles (long-form, 1,000+ words)

Distribution tactics:
• Comment on industry leaders' posts (visibility)
• Tag relevant people (mention influencers)
• Use 3-5 hashtags (niche-specific)
• Engage in first hour (algorithm boost)
```

**Twitter/X (Quick Insights):**
```
Frequency: 1-3 posts/day
Best times: Mon-Fri, 8-10 AM, 5-7 PM
Content types:
• Threads (10-tweet stories/frameworks)
• Quick tips (single tweets)
• Replies (conversations)
• Retweets with commentary

Distribution tactics:
• Reply to big accounts (piggyback visibility)
• Quote tweet trending topics
• Use 1-2 relevant hashtags
• Participate in Twitter chats
```

**Instagram (Visual, Lifestyle):**
```
Frequency: 4-7 posts/week
Best times: Mon-Fri, 11 AM-1 PM
Content types:
• Reels (short-form video, 15-90 sec)
• Carousels (swipeable infographics)
• Stories (daily updates, behind-the-scenes)
• Feed posts (polished visuals)

Distribution tactics:
• Use 15-30 hashtags (mix of sizes)
• Geotags (local discovery)
• Tag relevant accounts
• Story stickers (polls, questions)
```

**TikTok (Short-Form Video):**
```
Frequency: 1-3 videos/day
Best times: Tue-Thu, 7-9 PM
Content types:
• Quick tips (15-60 sec)
• Trends/challenges
• Educational (edutainment)

Distribution tactics:
• Use trending sounds
• Relevant hashtags (3-5)
• Hook in first 3 seconds
• Post consistently (algorithm rewards frequency)
```

**YouTube (Long-Form Video):**
```
Frequency: 1-2 videos/week
Best times: Weekdays, 2-4 PM
Content types:
• Tutorials (10-20 min)
• Vlogs (8-15 min)
• Reviews/comparisons

Distribution tactics:
• SEO-optimized titles/descriptions
• Custom thumbnails (high CTR)
• End screens (suggest next video)
• Community tab posts (tease upcoming videos)
```

---

## Earned Channel Distribution

### 1. Community Engagement

**Where to engage:**
- Reddit (relevant subreddits)
- Facebook Groups
- Slack communities
- Discord servers
- Online forums (niche-specific)

**How to do it right:**
```
❌ Don't: Spam links to your content
✅ Do: Provide value first, share when relevant

Example:
Someone asks: "How do I improve my cold email reply rate?"

Your response:
"I've tested this extensively. Here's what works:
1. [Quick tip]
2. [Quick tip]
3. [Quick tip]

I wrote a full guide on this if you want more details: [link]"

Value first → Link second
```

**Engagement Strategy:**
```
• Answer 10 questions
• Share content once
• Repeat daily

Become helpful community member, not spammer
```

---

### 2. Guest Posting/Podcasting

**Guest Post Strategy:**
```
1. Identify target blogs (your audience reads)
2. Pitch unique angle (not published before)
3. Write high-quality post (1,500-2,500 words)
4. Include bio with link to your best content/lead magnet
5. Promote the guest post (drives traffic to host + you)
```

**Guest Podcast Strategy:**
```
1. List 50 podcasts your audience listens to
2. Research host (listen to 2-3 episodes)
3. Pitch unique angle/story
4. Deliver value on show
5. Mention your best resource (not salesy)
6. Share episode when live (your audience → their show)
```

**ROI:**
```
1 guest post on major blog = 500-5,000 new visitors
1 podcast appearance = 100-1,000 new listeners
10 appearances = 1,000-10,000 new audience members
```

---

### 3. Social Sharing/Amplification

**Make content shareable:**

**Add share buttons:**
- Top of post
- Bottom of post
- Floating sidebar

**Click-to-tweet quotes:**
```
"The average content marketer spends 80% of time creating, 20% distributing. The best do the opposite: 20% creating, 80% distributing."

[Click to Tweet This]
```

**Visual shareability:**
```
• Quote graphics (pull-quotes from content)
• Infographics (visualize frameworks)
• Memes (humorous take on industry topics)

These get shared 3-10x more than text
```

**Influencer mentions:**
```
Mention influencers in content:
"As [Influencer] says, '[quote]'"

Tag them when you share:
"Loved this insight from @influencer: [quote]. Full thoughts: [link]"

They often reshare (their audience sees your content)
```

---

### 4. Backlink Strategy (SEO)

**Build backlinks:**

**1. Resource pages:**
```
Find: "[Topic] + resources"
Example: "Marketing resources"

Pitch: "I noticed your resource page. I wrote a comprehensive guide on [topic] that might fit: [link]"
```

**2. Broken link building:**
```
Find broken links on authority sites
Pitch replacement with your content

Tool: Ahrefs, SEMrush (find broken links)
```

**3. Original research/data:**
```
Publish original data:
• Surveys (industry benchmarks)
• Analysis (trends, statistics)
• Case studies (unique insights)

Others cite your data = backlinks
```

---

## Paid Channel Distribution

### 1. Social Media Ads

**Platform Selection:**

**LinkedIn Ads (B2B):**
```
Best for: B2B SaaS, professional services, enterprise
CPC: $5-15
Targeting: Job title, company size, industry

Budget: $500-1,000/month minimum
```

**Facebook/Instagram Ads (B2C + B2B):**
```
Best for: E-commerce, courses, consumer products
CPC: $0.50-3
Targeting: Interests, behaviors, demographics

Budget: $300-500/month minimum
```

**Twitter Ads:**
```
Best for: Tech, startups, thought leadership
CPC: $0.50-2
Targeting: Keywords, followers of competitors

Budget: $200-500/month
```

---

**Ad Strategy:**
```
Don't: Send cold traffic directly to sale
Do: Offer lead magnet → Nurture → Sell

Funnel:
Ad → Lead magnet landing page → Email sequence → Offer
```

**Ad Creative:**
```
• Headline: Benefit-driven (not feature)
• Image: Eye-catching, high contrast
• Copy: Problem → Solution → CTA
• CTA: "Download Free Guide" (not "Learn More")
```

---

### 2. Retargeting

**Retarget website visitors:**

**Setup:**
```
1. Install Facebook Pixel on website
2. Create custom audience (visitors)
3. Run retargeting ads

Audience segments:
• Blog visitors (not buyers)
• Landing page visitors (didn't convert)
• Cart abandoners (e-commerce)
```

**Ad messaging:**
```
For blog visitors:
"Enjoyed the article? Get the full playbook (free): [link]"

For landing page visitors:
"Still thinking about it? Here's what others are saying: [testimonials]"
```

**ROI:**
```
Retargeting typically converts 2-5x better than cold traffic
Lower CPC (warm audience)
```

---

## Distribution Schedule

### Daily Distribution Tasks (30 min)

**Morning (15 min):**
- Share new content on 2-3 social platforms
- Respond to comments on yesterday's posts
- Engage with 5-10 industry posts (comment thoughtfully)

**Afternoon/Evening (15 min):**
- Email new content to list (if publishing today)
- Cross-post to relevant communities (1-2)
- Schedule next day's social posts

---

### Weekly Distribution Tasks (2 hours)

**Monday:**
- Plan week's distribution (what content to share)
- Schedule social posts for week (Buffer/Hootsuite)

**Wednesday:**
- Engage in communities (Reddit, groups)
- Reply to podcast/guest post pitches

**Friday:**
- Review analytics (what performed well)
- Repurpose top content into new formats
- Plan next week's content

---

### Monthly Distribution Tasks (4 hours)

- **Outreach:** Pitch 5-10 guest post/podcast opportunities
- **Partnerships:** Reach out to 3-5 potential collaborators
- **SEO:** Build 5-10 new backlinks
- **Ads:** Review ad performance, adjust budgets
- **Email:** Clean list, segment further

---

## Cross-Platform Distribution

### The Waterfall Method

**Publish in this order:**

```
Day 1: Publish on owned platform (blog/YouTube)
  ↓
Day 1 (2 hours later): Email to list
  ↓
Day 1-2: Social media (LinkedIn, Twitter, Instagram)
  ↓
Day 3-4: Communities (Reddit, groups)
  ↓
Day 5-7: Repurposed formats (threads, carousels, clips)
  ↓
Week 2: Syndicate to Medium, LinkedIn Articles
  ↓
Week 3-4: Paid promotion (if using ads)
```

**Why waterfall:**
- Maximizes organic reach first
- Creates social proof (shares/engagement) before paying
- Spreads out distribution (doesn't overwhelm followers)

---

## Distribution Multipliers

### 1. Timing

**Best posting times by platform:**

**LinkedIn:**
- Tue-Thu, 9-11 AM, 12-2 PM

**Twitter:**
- Mon-Fri, 8-10 AM, 5-7 PM

**Instagram:**
- Mon-Fri, 11 AM-1 PM

**Email:**
- Tue-Thu, 9-11 AM

**Note:** Test your own audience (may vary)

---

### 2. Engagement Loops

**Boost distribution with engagement:**

```
Within first hour of posting:
• Reply to every comment (algorithm boost)
• Ask question in post (encourages comments)
• Tag relevant people (increases shares)
• Share in your stories (additional visibility)
```

---

### 3. Content Partnerships

**Cross-promotion:**

```
Find complementary creators:
Example: You teach email marketing, they teach social media

Partner strategy:
• Mention each other's content
• Guest on each other's platforms
• Co-create content
• Share each other's lead magnets

Both audiences benefit, both creators grow
```

---

## Measuring Distribution Success

**Key Metrics:**

**Reach:**
- Impressions (how many saw it)
- Unique visitors (how many people)

**Engagement:**
- Likes, comments, shares
- Click-through rate (CTR)
- Time on page

**Conversion:**
- Email signups
- Lead downloads
- Sales/demos booked

**Goal:** Improve all 3 over time

---

## Common Distribution Mistakes

### ❌ Create Once, Post Once
**Problem:** Content dies after one post
**Fix:** Repurpose and reshare over weeks/months

### ❌ No Email Strategy
**Problem:** Relying only on social (algorithm risk)
**Fix:** Build email list, send every new piece

### ❌ Spray and Pray
**Problem:** Post everywhere without strategy
**Fix:** Focus on 2-3 platforms where your audience is

### ❌ No Engagement
**Problem:** Post and disappear
**Fix:** Engage in first hour (replies, comments)

### ❌ Only Self-Promotion
**Problem:** Only share your own content
**Fix:** 80% engage with others, 20% self-promote

---

## Distribution Checklist

**Before Publishing:**
- [ ] Content is high-quality (worth distributing)
- [ ] SEO optimized (keywords, meta)
- [ ] Social share buttons added
- [ ] Email draft ready
- [ ] Social posts scheduled (3-5 platforms)

**Day of Publishing:**
- [ ] Publish to owned channel (blog/YouTube)
- [ ] Email to list (within 2 hours)
- [ ] Post on social (2-3 platforms)
- [ ] Share in 1-2 communities
- [ ] Engage with all comments/replies

**Week After Publishing:**
- [ ] Repurposed into 5-10 micro-content pieces
- [ ] Cross-posted to syndication platforms
- [ ] Reached out for backlinks/shares
- [ ] Analyzed performance (what worked)

**Scheduling:**
- Buffer ($6-12/mo)
- Hootsuite ($99/mo)
- Later (free-$40/mo)

- ConvertKit ($29/mo)
- Mailchimp (free-$20/mo)

**Analytics:**
- Google Analytics (free)
- Social platform native analytics

**SEO:**
- Ahrefs ($99/mo)
- SEMrush ($119/mo)
- Ubersuggest ($29/mo)

---

## Distribution ROI

**Effort vs. Reach:**

```
No distribution: 50 views (organic only)
Basic distribution (social + email): 500 views (10x)
Advanced distribution (all channels): 5,000 views (100x)

Same content, 100x more reach
```

**Time Investment:**
```
Create content: 10 hours
Distribute content: 2 hours

Distribution = 20% of time, 80% of results
```
